intro: Perityle megalocephala var. oligophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaved perityle, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the daisy family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in alpine or subalpine regions. It is a perennial herb that thrives in cool, moist environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
